snippet: Some women are combining the dual challenges of motherhood and start-up companies — dispelling the image of the tech entrepreneur as a single, usually male, wunderkind.
abstract: Some women are combining the dual challenges of motherhood and start-up companies--dispelling the image of the tech entrepreneur as a single, usually male, wunderkind; founders typically do the jobs of at least five people and the expectation is that a founder should be entirely devoted to the company with little competition for her attention; women make up 10 percent of the founders at high-growth tech companies.
lead_paragraph: Some women are combining the dual challenges of motherhood and start-up companies — dispelling the image of the tech entrepreneur as a single, usually male, wunderkind.

headline.seo: Nurturing a Baby and a Start-Up Business
headline.main: Nurturing a Baby and a Start-Up Business
headline.print_headline: Nurturing a Baby and a Business
